Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Full-time (40 hrs per week), Remote

About Us:

At The Global Talent Co., we provide opportunities to work with leading innovative technology companies worldwide, offering stable employment, competitive compensation, career growth, and access to a community of 25k+ like-minded marketing professionals.

This role is with an EU based innovative, rapidly growing company in the nail polish industry, offering high-quality products for discerning customers worldwide. They are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their team.

As a Junior Data Analyst in their fast-growing startup, you’ll have the opportunity to indulge your passion for data analysis and actively shape the future of data-driven decision-making. They are looking for committed individuals who want to grow with them.

Responsibilities:


Data Warehouse Management: Develop, maintain, and optimise data warehouses to ensure efficient and accurate data storage and retrieval.
Dashboard Creation & Maintenance: Design and maintain dashboards to provide clear and actionable insights for various teams within the organisation.
Cross-Team Communication: Collaborate with different teams to understand their data needs and visualise these requirements in effective dashboards.


Requirements:


Entry Level (1-2 years experience).
Studying or having completed a degree in Computer Science.
Proficient in programming languages such as SQL (very important) and Python (nice to have).
Familiarity with Data Warehouses like Snowflake, BigQuery, Postgres, or Data Lake.
Experience with data tools such as dbt (good signal).
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Metabase, Holistics, or PowerBI.
Strong communication skills to explain data insights to non-technical team members.
Ability to identify and meet the data needs of various teams.
Previous experience as a Consultant in Data Analytics, Data Warehouse, or Business Intelligence is highly desirable.
Fluent in English
Available to work full-time in the same time zone as our primary business operations (GMT/UTC +2)


Join our team and be part of a collaborative and innovative environment where your skills and expertise will make a real impact. We offer competitive compensation, professional development opportunities, and a supportive team culture. Apply now and take the next step in your career!

At The Global Talent Co., our mission is to bridge the gap between leading global tech companies and amazing global talent. We believe everyone deserves equal access to opportunities, regardless of the country they are born in.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making and support the continuous improvement of our operations and services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, data modeling, and statistical analysis, with a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Independently analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights, framing problems correctly, cleaning, and interpreting data sets.
Structure complex analytical CTEs in modeling pipelines using advanced SQL techniques, including window functions.
Develop reliable and accurate analytical workflows using DBT to create analytics models.
Apply statistical and analytical methods confidently to generate insights on specific issues or domain problems.
Develop efficient tracking concepts, extend existing events and attributes, and proactively resolve tracking issues.
Manage the delivery of technical stories by collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, supporting data literacy initiatives.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, creating understandable summaries of reports.
Influence stakeholders by working on dashboards with company/department-wide impact, ensuring stakeholder engagement for realizing value.


ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for advanced data modeling, experience with DBT for creating analytics models, and familiarity with statistical analysis methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and propose relevant metrics.
Good understanding of the current domain or the ability to quickly acquire expertise and fluency in the domain.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams, sharing knowledge and supporting junior team members.
Detailed knowledge of data sources within the immediate domain and support for data literacy initiatives within the company.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from forecasting customers’ lifetime value, optimise our bidding strategies in ad networks or measure the incrementality of our different marketing channels.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 80 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.


Who You Are


2-4 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Become a part of our success with virtual stock options
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media, Fox Education and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information
Show more

Title: IIoT Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Factory Pal

IIoT & Business Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0? Join us and be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize manufacturing process to improve shopfloor performance!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up, poised to become the leading end to end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping, how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but at the same time is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their jobs.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:

Data Transformation and Analysis
Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.

Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting
Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.

Stakeholder Management & Product Development
Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customers’ machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPal’s analytics solution.

Your Experience & Skills

Bachelor or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
>2 years experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (first experience with dbt is a plus)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing code and collaboration
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent

What You Get

Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access of our mother company Körber
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
[Porto] Our inspiring Porto office that serves as technology hub for the entire Körber group
[Berlin] Our amazing Berlin office in the AI Campus with access to Berlin’s AI ecosystem
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment with great colleagues
A competitive salary & benefits package and dedicated training budget

Show more

Title: Junior Controller / Data Analyst
Description:
Die Havelland Express Frischdienst GmbH ist ein erfolgreiches mittelständisches Unternehmen, das die gehobene Hotellerie und Gastronomie mit Lebensmitteln beliefert. Als Vollsortimenter bieten wir unseren Kunden eine große Auswahl an frischen und tiefgekühlten Produkten. Von unserem Geschäftssitz in Berlin Tempelhof aus beliefern wir unsere Kunden in ganz Deutschland, Polen, Tschechien und im Baltikum.

Zur Verstärkung unseres hochmotivierten Teams suchen wir per sofort an unserem Standort Berlin in Vollzeit eine/n Junior Controller*in / Data Analyst, (m/w/d)

Aufgaben


Analyse von internen und externen Daten zur Identifizierung von Optimierungspotenzialen
Überwachung der Preis- und Erlösentwicklung
Budgetüberwachung und -steuerung
Erstellung von Wirtschaftlichkeitsanalysen, Deckungsbeitragsrechnung, statistischen Meldungen und adhoc-Auswertungen
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Datenqualität, Stammdatenpflege
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen IT und Einkauf, Lager & Logistik, QS, Verkauf


Profil


Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwesen, Mathematik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Wirtschaftsingenieurswesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL
Erste bis mehrjährige Erfahrung oder Praktika im Controlling und Bereich Datenanalyse
Optional: Erfahrung bei der Implementierung von KI-unterstützter Software
Ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis, Leistungsbereitschaft, Teamfähigkeit und Flexibilität
Gute Organisations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, selbständiges Arbeiten
Sehr gute MS-Office-Kenntnisse, insbesondere MS Excel
IT-Kenntnisse: SQL von Vorteil, BI-Software Qlik von Vorteil
Deutsch C1 / Englisch B1


Wir bieten

Wir bieten eine leistungsgerechte Vergütung, einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten und dynamischen Team.


Leistungsgerechte Vergütung
Moderner Arbeitsplatz in einem sympathischen, motivierten Team
Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte und Sozialleistungen
Regelmäßige Firmenevents
BVG-Zuschuss und Parkplätze vorhanden
Kantine und Getränkeversorgung im Unternehmen


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE
Show more

  • Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte und Sozialleistungen
  • Regelmäßige Firmenevents
  • BVG-Zuschuss und Parkplätze vorhanden
  • Kantine und Getränkeversorgung im Unternehmen

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

In light of rapidly evolving and scaling up its development trajectory, Billie has recently set up a Portfolio Risk Management function. The main objective is to measure, control and drive decisions to optimize one of the core business metrics - portfolio losses. In order to do so, the team manages risk by researching and innovating, strategizing and recommending risk mitigating actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data (Risk) Analyst to join our Portfolio Management team and contribute to the development and enhancement of our portfolio risk management system.

In this role, you will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide risk decisions within the company values and expectations and be able to mitigate risks while at the same time embrace growth opportunities.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

Responsibilities


Perform in-depth portfolio data analysis from various angles (credit risk, fraud, acceptance rate and funnel) to develop a deep understanding of business processes and product, and to support risk optimisation
Design data models as part of data business warehouses to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update Portfolio management dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding portfolio performance, communicate key insights and recommendations to relevant stakeholders
Perform in-depth data analysis to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Identify and analyze potential sources of loss to minimize risk and estimate the potential financial consequences of a loss
Connect all business stakeholders in order to present portfolio’s KPIs and drive the business approach to managing risk
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have at least 3-4 years proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative risk analytics
You have excellent proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Experience in designing KPI dashboards for all types of audiences up to C-level
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You are proficient in data visualization and analytics tools, like Tableau, Power BI, Looker
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organised, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple responsibilities
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the team:

Within the Global Operations organisation, our mission is to build the best customer experience in the fintech industry by delivering an effortless journey to all our merchants. We are looking for a skilled and passionate Senior Data Analyst to join our talented Data & Insights Team.

As a Senior Data Analyst at SumUp, you will be responsible for pushing forward a data-driven culture within the Operations organisation. You will be the primary point of contact for the Customer Success team, working alongside them to define and evaluate impactful retention, acquisition, and growth campaigns. Additionally, you will directly impact the definition of the merchant activation journey, allowing the business to identify weak areas in the funnel and understand Churn across different business segments. You will work with other data analysts, analytics engineers and data scientists to leverage business knowledge into impactful insights and recommendations.

What You’ll Do


Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Customer Success and Operations Leadership teams.
Partner up with Operations Leadership to develop strategies based on data-driven insights and qualitative analysis, focusing on Customer Lifecycle and Churn.
Visualise insights and interpret results to present findings to stakeholders across the organisation, providing actionable recommendations based on your analysis.
Help define and implement KPIs to measure the success of acquisition, retention and growth campaigns driven by CSM.
Leverage SQL and data modelling best practices to manage and transform high volumes of data into actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies.
Mentor junior members to elevate analytics across the team.


You’ll be great for this position if you have:


5+ years experience working as a Data Analyst, preferably with knowledge of customer behaviour and lifecycle.
Proficiency in developing, optimising and validating SQL queries and data models.
Hands-on experience developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working independently as well as play a key role in mentoring and guiding others in a team


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.
Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
At Seven Senders, we connect people and markets, making international shipping a simple matter.

We are the leading platform for cross-border parcel delivery in Europe. We support e-commerce companies in successfully implementing their growth and internationalization plans and connecting millions of consumers with their desired products. Whether the focus is on speed or cost efficiency, we provide direct access to Europe's premier local carriers. Responsible for the daily end-to-end supply chain from the warehouse to the customer's doorstep, we ensure the parcels reach their destination efficiently and reliably.

Our mission is to connect markets with unparalleled ease using our innovative platform, which combines the best European delivery services with local logistics expertise. Since Johannes Plehn and Thomas Hagemann founded the company in Berlin in 2015, we've grown into a dedicated team of over 220 professionals. Today, we're proud to serve renowned clients such as ASOS, Shop Apotheke and Tamaris, continually advancing our journey as a European operating champion.



Job Description



At Seven Senders, our Business Intelligence team, led by Jimi Herrera, stands as the cornerstone of our data-driven ethos. We champion self-sufficient BI, fueling analytics and informed decisions with cutting-edge technology and streamlined workflows. We merge internal and external data from the 7S supply chain within our data hub, delivering enhanced intelligence and optimal automation to all stakeholders.


In this role, you will work closely with our data engineers to provide the best data models and collaborate with different stakeholders from the business on all levels to make data-driven decisions. You will be working to conduct a thorough analysis of large and complex data sets to extract meaningful insights.


The essence of your role

Develop and maintain robust data models, reports, and dashboards to analyze and visualize complex datasets.
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutions.
Ensure quality control over data, analyses, and metrics.
Provide recommendations to the business by interpreting disparate data and translating ad hoc requests to deliver relevant and impactful results consistently.
Work closely with Data Engineers to provide the best data models.



Qualifications



This is what you need to succeed

+4 years of professional experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Analyst, or in a relevant field.
Excellent SQL skills with experience with cloud-based data warehouse solutions (Snowflake experience is a plus).
High proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Previous experience in e-commerce or logistics.
Proactive and solution-oriented attitude.



Additional Information



What we offer:

Flexible & Hybrid Work: Our office is at Alexanderplatz; we have a hybrid working model with flexible remote-office set-up and working hours. And if you wish, you can work from almost anywhere for up to 2 months per year.

Personal Growth: We want you to grow and develop your career with us. In addition to exciting opportunities, we offer a development platform with professional training programs and a culture that champions personal and career development.

Benefits: We offer a corporate benefits platform and German & English language courses.

Mission Zero: Climate-neutral and long-term impact. With our green initiatives, we are reaching climate neutrality for ourselves, and hopefully, we're inspiring the entire logistics sector to join us to create a sustainable future.

Vibrant Culture & Community: We embody collaboration, open doors, and no-fuss results focus, and we are successful with our data-driven and efficient working approach. We like to celebrate and come together, and we strive for a workplace buzzing with energy and camaraderie, highlighted by regular team events, BBQs, and company-wide celebrations.

Inclusive Environment: We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or disability.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Bestandskunden
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Unterstützung bei Entwicklung und Implementierung einer effizienten Power BI Reportingstruktur
Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von relevanten Kennzahlen und Geschäftsentwicklungen
Präsentation der Dashboards in deutscher Sprache für große Bestandskunden
Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architektur und der Automatisierung des Reportings in Zusammenarbeit mit der Fachabteilung


Dein Profil


mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Vertrieb oder einer anderen beratenden Tätigkeit
sehr gute Vorkenntnisse mit Programmen zur Datenauswertung (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Schrift und Sprache
Sicherer Umgang mit Excel und SQL
sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten für Kunden in deutscher Sprache
Kenntnisse im Auf-/Ausbau von BI-Systemen
Strukturierte, sowie analytische Arbeitsweise
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement im SaaS-Umfeld


Warum wir?


Die "Basics": 30 Tage Urlaub, bis zu 100% remote work möglich, ein fester Feierabend, Mac oder PC- du hast die Wahl, ein Budget für deine Weiterentwicklung, Team-Events, E-Bike, Altersvorsorge und Gutscheine für Amazon & Co. sind einige der Angebote, die unsere CallOne´ler zu schätzen wissen.
We ♥️ AI: Nicht nur bei unseren SaaS-Lösungen, auch im Arbeitsalltag setzen wir auf die unzähligen Möglichkeiten, die KI uns bietet, um Prozesse zu optimieren und uns unsere Arbeit zu erleichtern. Freu dich auf ein tech- und experimentier-freudiges Team, mit dem du tief in die Welt der Künstlichen Intelligenz eintauchen kannst! =)
Arbeit mit Sinn: Mit deiner Arbeit hast du einen positiven Einfluss auf Millionen von Menschen. Unsere Lösungen sind immer einen Herzschlag voraus und setzen neue Standards im Kundenservice. So leistest du mit deiner Arbeit einen echten Mehrwert und trägst dazu bei, dass Service Hotlines ihrem Namen endlich wieder alle Ehre machen.
Teamwork: Was wir an CallOne besonders lieben? Unsere Kollegen (w/m/d)! Wir halten einander den Rücken frei, nehmen uns selbst nicht zu ernst und können uns immer aufeinander verlassen. Egal ob remote oder an einem unserer drei Standorte, bei uns ist Team Work keine hohle Phrase!
Job Crafting 4.0: Du gestaltest deinen Job, mit deiner Erfahrung, deinen Stärken, Ideen und Vorlieben. Wir fördern dich mit allem, was du dafür brauchst, und entwerfen gemeinsamen den Job, der zu dir und deinem Leben passt.
Gemeinsam wachsen: Dein Wissen ist unser aller Gewinn. Deshalb spielen wir dir regelmäßig Updates auf, in Form von Konferenzen, Workshops, Kursen, Trainings, neuster Technik – was immer du brauchst, um dich beruflich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln.
Kein Lari-Fari: Was du tust, vergammelt nicht in einer Schublade, sondern kommt zum Einsatz. Auf unnötige Bürokratie und stundenlange Meetings haben wir keine Lust. Wir arbeiten fokussiert, hands-on und mit einem Blick fürs Wesentliche.


Über uns

Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der Kommunikation!

Bist du bereit für den nächsten Schritt? Wir suchen kreative Köpfe, die mit uns und mit Hilfe von KI-gestützten Technologien die Art und Weise, wie Unternehmen interagieren, neu definieren wollen. Lass dich von unserer Vision inspirieren und entdecke spannenden Karrieremöglichkeiten bei uns – bewirb dich noch heute auf unsere offenen Stellen!

Du möchtest mehr über uns erfahren? ➡️ comdesk.de/ueber-uns
Show more
HTML:
Deine Aufgaben

  • Unterstützung bei Entwicklung und Implementierung einer effizienten Power BI Reportingstruktur
  • Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von relevanten Kennzahlen und Geschäftsentwicklungen
  • Präsentation der Dashboards in deutscher Sprache für große Bestandskunden
  • Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architektur und der Automatisierung des Reportings in Zusammenarbeit mit der Fachabteilung

Dein Profil

  • mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Kundenservice, Vertrieb oder einer anderen beratenden Tätigkeit
  • sehr gute Vorkenntnisse mit Programmen zur Datenauswertung (z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
  • fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Schrift und Sprache
  • Sicherer Umgang mit Excel und SQL
  • sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten für Kunden in deutscher Sprache
  • Kenntnisse im Auf-/Ausbau von BI-Systemen
  • Strukturierte, sowie analytische Arbeitsweise

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

About the Role:


Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.


About You:


Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


Big Data Skills:


3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
Experience with Scala testing frameworks
Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Stellenbeschreibung

Du willst die digitale Zukunft von Bund, Ländern und Kommunen mitgestalten? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir bei CGI arbeiten in gemischten Teams aus erfahrenen Mitarbeiter:innen und Berufseinsteiger:innen in agilen Projekten an der Entwicklung von Lösungen für die digitale Transformation Deutschlands. Bei all unseren Projekten haben wir immer das gleiche Ziel: Wir wollen unseren Kunden helfen das Leben für Bürger:innen und öffentlich Bedienstete einfacher zu machen. Das möchtest du auch? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung als Data Engineer (m/f/d) an unseren Standorten Berlin, Köln oder Düsseldorf.

Aufgaben

Das erwartet dich bei uns

Als Data Engineer (m/f/d) bist du unsere erste Wahl, wenn es um die Anbindung, Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von

Daten im Kontext Analytics und BI geht. In Projekten unterstützt du als Teil der Data Intelligence-Einheit unsere Kunden

aus dem Public Sector bei den folgenden Aufgaben:


Design und Implementierung von Data Pipelines
Automation, Tuning und Betrieb von bestehenden Data Pipelines
Analyse und Bereinigung von Data Quality Issues
Betrieb und Optimierung eines hochverfügbaren SQL-Clusters
Entwicklung performanter Datenmodelle
Beratung bei der Auswahl der richtigen Technologien
Begleitung von Proof of Concepts – Neugier, Vielseitigkeit und Enthusiasmus sind hier eine große Hilfe


Qualifikation


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Computer Science, Data Science oder eine


vergleichbare Ausbildung


Praktische Berufserfahrung im Kontext Data Pipelines als Softwareengineer, Softwareentwickler, Data


Engineer oder ähnlichem Berufsfeld


Fundierte Erfahrungen in Datenmodellierung und Datenbankadministration insbesondere in SQL (z.B. in


MS SQL)


Gute Kenntnisse im Linux-Umfeld und/oder Windows-Umfeld
Vertrautheit mit Container¬ Plattformen (z. B. Docker) und Werkzeugen im Kontext CI/CD (z.B. Git,


Jenkins)


Von Vorteil sind gute Kenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache wie Java oder C#


und/oder Python oder R


Deutschkenntnisse auf C1 Level


Was wir bieten


Ein Team mit dem die Zusammenarbeit Spaß macht. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns über alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos.
Du arbeitest meist direkt an deinem Heimatort – weil wir Kundennähe wörtlich nehmen und uns Work-Life-Balance am Herzen liegt.
Du profitierst von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und hast je nach Kundensituation die Möglichkeit, von zuhause zu arbeiten.
Du bekommst ein Firmenhandy mit Vodafonevertrag (IPhone) auch für private Nutzung.
In der IT ist es wichtig immer auf dem neusten Stand zu bleiben, deshalb bringen die richtigen Trainings und Zertifikate deine Karriere voran. Neben unserer internen E-Learning-Plattform „Academia“ ermöglichen wir dir das Absolvieren von Schulungen und Zertifikaten.
Einen Teil des Bruttogehalts kannst du in CGI Aktien investieren – bis maximal 3 % des Monatsgehalts geben wir für jeden Euro einen weiteren hinzu.
Außerdem beteiligen wir dich am Unternehmenserfolg: Du erhältst eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach deiner individuellen Leistung, sowie der unternehmerischen finanziellen Zielerreichung des Unternehmens richtet.
Wir bieten verschiedene Mobilitäts-Modelle, wie Dienstfahrrad oder Firmenwagen.
Sabbatical oder Elternzeit werden unterstützt und sind bei uns kein Karriere-Stopper!
Wir sind an deiner Seite, auch wenn es einmal nicht so gut läuft. Du kannst Sonderurlaub nehmen, und unsere Beratungshotline stehen dir immer zur Verfügung.
Eine Vielzahl an gemeinsamen Events und Freizeitaktivitäten im Team.


Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

1976 gegründet und nach wie vor familiengeführt, ist CGI heute einer der weltweit größten unabhängigen Anbieter von IT und Business Consulting. Ein hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung, Teamwork, Respekt und Zusammenhalt machen das Arbeiten bei uns besonders. Bei uns kannst du dein volles Potenzial entfalten!

Du darfst dich vom ersten Tag an als Miteigentümer:in von CGI verstehen. Wir lassen unsere Vision gemeinsam Wirklichkeit werden. Wir profitieren von unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg und haben die Möglichkeit und die Verantwortung, die Strategie und Ausrichtung unseres Unternehmens aktiv mitzugestalten.

Deine Arbeit schafft Mehrwert. Du findest innovative Lösungen und stärkst dein Netzwerk aus Kolleg:innen und Kunden. Gleichzeitig hast du Zugang zu globalen Ressourcen, um große Ideen zu verwirklichen, neue Chancen zu nutzen und von der immensen Branchen- und Technologie-Kompetenz zu profitieren.

Du bringst deine Karriere voran, da du in einem Unternehmen arbeitest, das auf Wachstum und Langlebigkeit ausgelegt ist. Du wirst von Führungskräften unterstützt, die deine Gesundheit und Zufriedenheit fördern – und dir Möglichkeiten bieten, deine Fähigkeiten zu vertiefen und deinen Horizont zu erweitern.


Show more
